properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (String, Required, Change forces new resource) Network name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (String, Optional, Change forces new resource) Optional description of network.

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (String, Required, Change forces new resource) CIDR formatted string describing network.

properties.name: provision_start_ip
properties.description: • provision_start_ip - (String, Required, Change forces new resource) First IP on the network that can be assigned.

properties.name: provision_end_ip
properties.description: • provision_end_ip - (String, Required, Change forces new resource) Last assignable IP on the network.

properties.name: gateway
properties.description: • gateway - (String, Optional, Change forces new resource) Optional gateway IP.

properties.name: resolvers
properties.description: • resolvers - (List, Optional) Array of IP addresses for resolvers.

properties.name: routes
properties.description: • routes - (Map, Optional, Change forces new resource) Map of CIDR block to Gateway IP address.

properties.name: internet_nat
properties.description: • internet_nat - (Bool, Optional, Change forces new resource) If a NAT zone is provisioned at Gateway IP address. Default is true.

properties.name: vlan_id
properties.description: • vlan_id - (Int, Required, Change forces new resource) VLAN id the network is on. Number between 0-4095 indicating VLAN ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: rule
properties.description: • rule - (string, Required) The firewall rule described using the Cloud API rule syntax defined at https://docs.joyent.com/public-cloud/network/firewall/cloud-firewall-rules-reference. Note: Cloud API will normalize rules based on case-sensitivity, parentheses, ordering of IP addresses, etc. This can result in Terraform updating rules repeatedly if the rule definition differs from the normalized value.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (boolean, Optional) Default: false Whether the rule should be effective.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (string, Optional) Description of the firewall rule
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: template_name
properties.description: • template_name - (string, Required) Friendly name for the instance template.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (string, Required) UUID of the image.

properties.name: package
properties.description: • package - (string, Required) Package name used for provisioning.

properties.name: firewall_enabled
properties.description: • firewall_enabled - (boolean, Optional) Whether to enable the firewall for group instances. Default is false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (map, Optional) Tags for group instances.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (list, Optional) Network IDs for group instances.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (map, Optional) Metadata for group instances.

properties.name: userdata
properties.description: • userdata - (string, Optional) Data copied to instance on boot.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (string, Change forces new resource) The name of the key. If this is left empty, the name is inferred from the comment in the SSH key material.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (string, Required, Change forces new resource) The SSH key material. In order to read this from a file, use the file interpolation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (string) The friendly name for the machine. Triton will generate a name if one is not specified.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (map) A mapping of tags to apply to the machine.

properties.name: cns
properties.description: • cns - (map of CNS attributes, Optional) A mapping of CNS attributes to apply to the machine.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (map, optional) A mapping of metadata to apply to the machine.

properties.name: package
properties.description: • package - (string, Required) The name of the package to use for provisioning.

properties.name: image
properties.description: • image - (string, Required) The UUID of the image to provision.

properties.name: networks
properties.description: • networks - (list, optional) The list of networks to associate with the machine. The network ID will be in hex form, e.g xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx.

properties.name: affinity
properties.description: • affinity - (list of Affinity rules, Optional) A list of valid Affinity Rules to apply to the machine which assist in data center placement. Using this attribute will force resource creation to be serial. NOTE: Affinity rules are best guess and assist in placing instances across a data center. They're used at creation and not referenced after.

properties.name: (Deprecated) locality
properties.description: • (Deprecated) locality - (map of Locality hints, Optional) A mapping of Locality attributes to apply to the machine that assist in data center placement. NOTE: Locality hints are only used at the time of machine creation and not referenced after. Locality is deprecated as of CloudAPI v8.3.0.

properties.name: firewall_enabled
properties.description: • firewall_enabled - (boolean) Default: false Whether the cloud firewall should be enabled for this machine.

properties.name: root_authorized_keys
properties.description: • root_authorized_keys - (string) The public keys authorized for root access via SSH to the machine.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (string) Data to be copied to the machine on boot. NOTE: The content of user_data will not be executed on boot. The data will only be written to the file on each boot before the content of the script from user_script is to be run.

properties.name: user_script
properties.description: • user_script - (string) The user script to run on boot (every boot on SmartMachines). To learn more about both the user script and user data see the metadata API documentation and the Joyent Metadata Data Dictionary specification.

properties.name: administrator_pw
properties.description: • administrator_pw - (string) The initial password for the Administrator user. Only used for Windows virtual machines.

properties.name: cloud_config
properties.description: • cloud_config - (string) Cloud-init configuration for Linux brand machines, used instead of user_data.

properties.name: deletion_protection_enabled
properties.description: • deletion_protection_enabled - (bool) Whether an instance is destroyable. Default is false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: group_name
properties.description: • group_name - (string, Required) Friendly name for the service group.

properties.name: template
properties.description: • template - (string, Required) Identifier of an instance template.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (int, Optional) Number of instances to launch and monitor.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (string, Required) The name for the snapshot.

properties.name: machine_id
properties.description: • machine_id - (string, Required) The ID of the machine of which to take a snapshot.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vlan_id
properties.description: • vlan_id - (int, Required, Change forces new resource) Number between 0-4095 indicating VLAN ID

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (string, Required) Unique name to identify VLAN

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (string, Optional) Description of the VLAN
